title: Rub' al Khali
summary: The Rub' al Khali[note 1] (/ˈrʊb æl ˈkɑːli/;[1] Arabic: ٱلرُّبْع ٱلْخَالِي‎ (/ar.rubʕ alxaːliː/), the "Empty Quarter") is the sand desert (erg)[2] encompassing most of the southern third of the Arabian Peninsula. The desert covers some 650,000 km2 (250,000 sq mi) (the area of long. 44°30′−56°30′E, and lat. 16°30′−23°00′N) including parts of Saudi Arabia, Oman, the United Arab Emirates, and Yemen.[3] It is part of the larger Arabian Desert.
